questions.question: Basic compliance to CSA Z462 requirements is established with a five-step process for safety and operability.

The arc flash protection boundary is defined as the distance at which a worker is exposed to _____ calories/cm² of incident energy. This represents the distance at which PPE _____ (may, must) be worn to prevent 2nd-degree or greater burns in the event of an arc flash.
There are _____ identified FR hazardous risk category levels, which are numbered by severity from _____ to _____, that require the minimum levels of arc flash protection.
Describe the clothing necessary when the required minimum arc rating of PPE must be 40 cal/cm².
options: Arc-rated FR shirt and FR rated pants or FR coverall and arc flash suit selected so that the system arc rating meets the required minimum (3 or more layers).
Non-arc-rated cotton clothing with an additional arc flash suit to meet the required minimum.
Arc-rated FR shirt and pants only.
Standard work clothes with an arc flash suit jacket.
Arc-rated FR shirt and pants, or an arc flash suit with a minimum of two layers.
correctAnswer: Arc-rated FR shirt and FR rated pants or FR coverall and arc flash suit selected so that the system arc rating meets the required minimum (3 or more layers).

questions.question: Describe the six (6) basic steps for locking out and re-energizing equipment when you need to work on it.
options: a) Inform everyone who needs to know that the equipment needs to be shut down and for what reason
b) Shut down the equipment by the normal shutdown procedures
c) Operate the energy isolating devices to disconnect the equipment from the source of supply
d) Install your lock on each of the isolating devices and tag the locks
e) Check the equipment to confirm that it is isolated
f) After the work is completed, check the area, and confirm that it is safe to re-energize the equipment
correctAnswer: a) Inform everyone who needs to know that the equipment needs to be shut down and for what reason
b) Shut down the equipment by the normal shutdown procedures
c) Operate the energy isolating devices to disconnect the equipment from the source of supply
d) Install your lock on each of the isolating devices and tag the locks
e) Check the equipment to confirm that it is isolated
f) After the work is completed, check the area, and confirm that it is safe to re-energize the equipment

Which of the following terms matches the definition “When power or energy cannot flow due to the position of a disconnecting switch, circuit breaker, manually operated valve locked in position until work is complete, and the area deemed safe”?
When locking out a piece of equipment, you can use;

correctAnswer: A lock with only one key

questions.question: Painful shock causing ventricular fibrillation of the heart is most often a fatal heart condition. This condition is caused by what level of current in mA?
If dangers cannot immediately be corrected, you should do what three things to prevent injuries?
options: Provide physical barriers or suitably guard all hazardous conditions during the progress of the job until normal conditions are restored.
correctAnswer: Provide physical barriers or suitably guard all hazardous conditions during the progress of the job until normal conditions are restored.
